page.title: 12HOME LIFE IN HINXWORTH
page.content: "I can remember when most cottages were occupied by farm workers employed in the village or in Edworth. Few had electricity or water indoors. Lighting was by oil lamps, cooking by oil or "range" and drinking water came from taps in the street. Yet 5 grocers,3 bakers and 3 butchers all called regularly.The church had a large congregation, there was a chapel a school,a post office, resident police- man and roadman, a shop, a bakery, a men's club and the buses were always full! Now few houses are occupied by farm workers most having been sold off;only one butcher calls and no other tradesmen;and the chapel,P.O. and school have gone. On the other hand we are now on mains drainage and electricity, although there is still no gas, and the community as a whole is certainly wealthier."
